title: When I looked at the night sky tonight, I saw faint, distant stars quickly moving past other stars. What was I looking at? - Quora

response.answer_text: You were seeing much closer satellites moving past the far distant stars. The satellites were probably only 300 miles (450 km) or so above the ground. If you saw many at once, you were probably seeing a cluster of Elon Musk’s SpaceX “StarLink” communication satellites. They’re launched in batches of 60 per rocket, and gradually spread out over time to their assigned orbits. refs: Starlink - Wikipedia and Starlink

When you look at lights in the night sky you can’t tell how distant they are unless they move in front of clouds. Stars don’t move quickly. What you saw were UFOs. That is you couldn’t identify them. Possibilities include planes, helicopters, balloons and satellites.
